title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
shortDescription: A young wizard discovers his magical heritage.
fullDescription: Harry discovers on his 11th birthday that he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts. He makes friends, faces challenges, and learns about the dark wizard who once tried to kill him.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
shortDescription: A hobbit embarks on an unexpected adventure.
fullDescription: Bilbo Baggins is swept into a grand quest with a group of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo proves far braver than he believes himself to be.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
shortDescription: A story of love, manners, and misunderstanding.
fullDescription: Elizabeth Bennet must deal with matters of upbringing, morality, and marriage. Her clashes with Mr. Darcy reveal truths about pride, prejudice, and the nature of true love.

author: George Orwell
shortDescription: A dystopian society under constant surveillance.
fullDescription: Winston Smith lives in a totalitarian state controlled by Big Brother. As he begins to rebel, he learns the horrifying extent of the regime’s power and its manipulation of truth and reality.

title: Around the World in 80 Days
author: Jules Verne
shortDescription: An epic race across the globe.
fullDescription: Phileas Fogg accepts a bet to circumnavigate the globe in just 80 days. He and his loyal servant Passepartout face countless adventures in their race against time.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
shortDescription: A tale of passion and independence.
fullDescription: Orphaned Jane Eyre becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester. Secrets from his past test her strength, morality, and resilience.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
shortDescription: A poetic tale of innocence and love.
fullDescription: A pilot stranded in the desert meets a young prince from another planet. Through their conversations, he learns lessons about childhood, love, and what truly matters.

title: Of Human Bondage
author: W. Somerset Maugham
shortDescription: A deep study of human emotion and self-discovery.
fullDescription: Philip Carey seeks meaning in his life through relationships, art, and travel. His journey is one of internal conflict, personal struggle, and the quest for purpose.

title: White Fang
author: Jack London
shortDescription: A wild wolf-dog's journey to trust humans.
fullDescription: Born in the wild, White Fang must learn to survive both nature and man. His eventual bond with a kind owner shows the power of trust and compassion.
